pull.title: doc: add maxuploadtarget to bitcoin.conf example
pull.body:
picking up #21499, author has stated they [can't squash](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21499#issuecomment-849277632).

This adds the maxuploadtarget option to the `bitcoin.conf` example file. This is useful for those looking to configure their bandwidth utilization.

**Changes from Original PR:**
- squash commits
- fix typo in commit message + reword commit message to be more appropriate
- Implement review suggestions ([1](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21499#discussion_r615409982), [2](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21499#discussion_r615410337), [3](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21499#pullrequestreview-659357756))
- Fix spacing

events.message:
doc: add maxuploadtarget to bitcoin.conf example

Introduce the maxuploadtarget option to the example bitcoin.conf file. This adds visibility for this option which is useful to those looking to configure bandwidth usage.

events.body:
updated from 219bbd2 -> 947f973 ([pr22080.01](https://github.com/jarolrod/bitcoin/tree/pr22080.01) -> [pr22080.02](https://github.com/jarolrod/bitcoin/tree/pr22080.02), [diff](https://github.com/jarolrod/bitcoin/compare/pr22080.01...jarolrod:pr22080.02?diff=split))

**Changes:**
- Addressed suggestions ([1](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22080#discussion_r641540735), [2](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22080#discussion_r641582924)) from @theStack and @jonatack (thanks!)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -71,6 +71,12 @@
 # configuration option or the addnode RPC, which have a separate limit of 8 connections.
 #maxconnections=
 
+# Maximum upload bandwidth target in MiB per day (e.g. 'maxuploadtarget=1024' is 1 GiB max throughput per day).
comments.body:
```suggestion
# Maximum upload bandwidth target in MiB per day (e.g. 'maxuploadtarget=1024' is 1 GiB per day).
```

nit: The "max throughput" is kind of redundant to the part before the parantheses, but I'm fine with either version.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -71,6 +71,12 @@
 # configuration option or the addnode RPC, which have a separate limit of 8 connections.
 #maxconnections=
 
+# Maximum upload bandwidth target in MiB per day (e.g. 'maxuploadtarget=1024' is 1 GiB max throughput per day).

@@ -71,6 +71,12 @@
 # configuration option or the addnode RPC, which have a separate limit of 8 connections.
 #maxconnections=
 
+# Maximum upload bandwidth target in MiB per day (e.g. 'maxuploadtarget=1024' is 1 GiB max throughput per day).
+# This limits the upload bandwidth for those with bandwidth limits. 0 = no limit (default: 0).
+# Limit does not apply to peers with 'download' permission.
comments.body:
s/Limit/This limit/ or (probably better as it is more explicit): 
```suggestion
# -maxuploadtarget does not apply to peers with 'download' permission.
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -71,6 +71,12 @@
 # configuration option or the addnode RPC, which have a separate limit of 8 connections.
 #maxconnections=
 
+# Maximum upload bandwidth target in MiB per day (e.g. 'maxuploadtarget=1024' is 1 GiB max throughput per day).
+# This limits the upload bandwidth for those with bandwidth limits. 0 = no limit (default: 0).
+# Limit does not apply to peers with 'download' permission.
comments.body: Thanks, addressed in  947f973  by using the `-maxuploadtarget` suggestion
